avalancheActivity.comment: The more recent wind slabs can be released in particular on steep shady slopes above the tree line, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Avalanches can in very isolated cases penetrate near-ground layers of the snowpack and reach medium size. The mostly small wind slabs are clearly recognisable to the trained eye. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of small moist avalanches will increase. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies in particular on very steep sunny slopes in the western and central Prealps. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The mostly small wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The fresh wind slabs are lying on unfavourable layers in particular on steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes.
In some localities up to 10 cm of snow has fallen. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to moistening of the snowpack on steep sunny slopes.
Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. Snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The old wind slabs are small and can only be released in isolated cases. Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found on extremely steep shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations.
Shady slopes: The snowpack consists of faceted crystals.
In some localities 0 to 5 cm of snow has fallen. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack on steep slopes. Only a small amount of snow is lying for the time of year. The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations.
